CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: To obtain the ideal low band gap polymer with appropriate energy levels that can make a tradeoff between open circuit voltage ( V oc ) and band gap so as to maximize the PCE , an intriguing approach involves incorporat - ing electron rich moieties ( donor , D ) and electron deficient moieties ( acceptor , A ) and alternating them on the backbone , which are so - called D-A type low band gap conjugated polymers.

Let's think step by step.

Sure! Here are the "Material Name" entities in the paragraph, presented in a Markdown table with one column "Material Name":

| Material Name |
| --- |
| Low band gap polymer |
| D-A type low band gap conjugated polymers |
| Donor (D) |
| Acceptor (A) |

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Of course! Here are the valid "Material Name" entities in the paragraph, presented in a Markdown table with one column "Material Name":

| Material Name |
| --- |
| Low band gap polymer |
| D-A type low band gap conjugated polymers |

I have removed the following entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name":

* "intriguing approach" (this is a general term that does not refer to a specific material)
* "electron rich moieties" (this is a general term that refers to a class of materials, rather than a specific material name)
* "electron deficient moieties" (similar to the previous entity)
* "D-A type low band gap conjugated polymers" (this is a specific type of material, so it has been included in the list of valid material names)
